content.description: Good Thing is one of the better short bouldery lines in the Gorge (there aren't that many). It starts at the top of the scree slope which makes a horrible belay spot. Climb crimps up to the second bolt then awkwardly pull into the undercling and make a long reach up left to a crimp.  Paste your feet on the tiny edges and deadpoint for a good edge. This first crux is hard and somewhat heady since your feet are above the second bolt and the ground ain't that far away.  At the third bolt another long dynamic move to an edge, followed by a hard gaston move at the fourth. After this its easy climbing up the arete if you can still hold on. Hard for the short.

An aesthetic line in a unique position, the entire climb is directly over the river. Techy and fingery off-vertical climbing. Start on the left side of the arête, immediately turn the arête and climb the right side for 3 bolts. The climb then leaves the arête and follows a sequence of pockets to gain a right facing flake/seam. Lower off.
content.location:
Located just to the right of Bongo Fury.

*This route is climbable at normal river levels, including the new higher norm that the river has been held at as of Jan 2020. There may be a plank at the base of the route to place over the water to belay from.

**Its also possible to approach Dancin' Fool and Bongo Fury top-down from The Office.

content.description: Techy arete climbing. Bouldery cruxes. Great rock. Super fun!
content.location: Just down stream from Good Thing and Bad Thing on the west side of the river.

content.description: This is just to the climber's right of Good Thing and takes the left angling feature to a bulgy crux and a pumpy clip.
content.location: Walk around the backside of the Gorgeous Tower and you'll see two bolt lines.  Bad Thing is the one on the climber's right.
